title: Jesus Christ, titles and descriptions of

children.title: Jesus Christ, titles and names of
children.comment: These, in their rich variety, throw light on either the person of Jesus Christ or on some aspect of his ministry.

children.title: Jesus, the Christ
children.comment: ``Christ'' means ``Messiah'' or ``anointed one''. As the Christ, Jesus is the one who fulfils all OT expectations. Paul's phrase ``in Christ'' indicates the intimate relationship between Jesus Christ and his people.

children.title: The Christ as the anointed one
The act of anointing in the OT

primaryrefs.comment: Anointing symbolises God's calling and being equipped by his Spirit.

children.title: Anointed OT leaders
The OT promise of a future anointed leader
Jesus' own claims to be the Christ
Jesus recognised as the Christ
Jesus' demand that his identity as the Christ should not be publicised

primaryrefs.comment: Jesus' reluctance to be known as the Christ is probably due to Jewish misunderstandings of the Messiah's true role.

children.title: Grounds for affirming Jesus as the Christ
Jesus Christ's birth in Bethlehem
Jesus Christ's spiritual anointing from God
Jesus Christ's proclamation of Jubilee

seealsos.comment: Isaiah's words are borrowed from the language of the Year of Jubilee (Leviticus chapter 25), which was to be a time when true freedom was restored.

children.title: Jesus Christ's healing ministry
Jesus Christ's prophetic ministry
Jesus Christ's suffering, death and resurrection
Jesus Christ's fulfilment of prophecy
God's establishment of Jesus Christ as king
Messianic titles used of Jesus
Son of David
Son of God
The Prophet
King of the Jews
High priest
Israel's rejection of Jesus as the Christ
Jesus' messiahship was largely rejected by the Jews
Jesus was accused of blasphemy because of his claims to be the Christ
That Jesus is the Christ is a central Christian belief
The apostles' message was that Jesus is the Christ
Jesus Christ is the representative head of the church
Baptism is into Christ
Jesus Christ lives within believers
Jesus Christ, as the truth
Jesus Christ, head of the church
children.comment: Jesus Christ rules and governs his people and directs them towards the fulfilment of God's purposes. All power and authority within the church derive from Jesus Christ as the head.

children.title: Jesus Christ rules the universe in the interest of the church
All power and authority within the church derive from Jesus Christ as the head
Jesus Christ is recognised as head of the church
Within the church Jesus Christ alone rules with authority
The church owes obedience to its head
All human authority in the church derives from its head
Jesus Christ is the cornerstone and builder of the church
Jesus Christ's role as head of the church
He loves the church
He cares for the church
He provides for the growth of the church
He prays for the church
He judges the church
He will present the church blameless before God
Jesus Christ, Son of David
children.comment: A Messianic title. Jesus Christ comes as a descendant of David to fulfil God's promises in the OT of a future king who would establish the kingdom of God on earth.

children.title: OT promises of a future king from David's line

primaryrefs.comment: These promises are known as ``the Davidic covenant''

children.title: NT statements verifying that Jesus Christ is descended from David
Jesus Christ inherits the throne of David
Jesus Christ is called ``Son of David''
By those seeking healing
At his triumphal entry into Jerusalem
Grounds for identifying Jesus Christ as the Son of David
His human descent
His birth in Bethlehem
His healing ministry

primaryrefs.comment: One of the signs of the Messianic age was the healing of the sick (see Isa 35:5-6; 42:7).

children.title: His ultimate victory
Jesus Christ is more than a merely human king descended from David

primaryrefs.comment: Jesus Christ claim is that he is not simply a human or political king, he is the Lord, the Son of God.

children.title: Jesus Christ, Son of God
children.comment: A title emphasising Jesus Christ's deity, his office as Messiah and his pre-eminence as the object of the church's faith and worship and as the content of its gospel.

children.title: ``Son of God'' in the OT
Israel as God's son
The future Messiah/king as God's Son

seealsos.comment: Jesus Christ perfectly fulfils all the OT promises concerning God's son, whether referring originally to Israel or to the Messiah.

children.title: Jesus Christ is the Son of God
Jesus Christ affirms he is God's Son
The Father affirms Jesus Christ is his Son
Others affirm Jesus Christ is God's Son
Demons affirm Jesus Christ is God's Son
``Son of God'' as a taunt
children.precomment: By the devil in the wilderness:

children.title: ``Son of God'' stresses Jesus Christ's deity
Jesus Christ is the Son of God the Father

primaryrefs.comment: In John's Gospel in particular, the terms Son/Father are used many times to speak of Jesus Christ's unique relationship with God.

children.title: ``Son of God'' implies Jesus Christ's equality with God
``Son of God'' implies Jesus Christ's obedience to the Father
Jesus Christ as ``Son of God'' is the Messiah
``Son of God'' as a Messianic title for Jesus Christ
``Son of God'' as one sent by God
Grounds for regarding Jesus Christ as the Son of God
The virgin birth
Jesus Christ's resurrection
Jesus Christ's works
Jesus Christ's oneness with the Father
Jesus Christ as Son of God is the object of the church's faith
Jesus Christ as Son of God is the content of the church's gospel
Jesus Christ, Son of Man
children.comment: Jesus Christ's preferred title for himself. The term points to the humanity and servanthood of Christ, but also reflects Daniel's vision of the son of man as a coming figure of judgment and authority.

children.title: Jesus Christ as the Son of Man in his human nature
OT use of ``son of man'' to mean ``human being''
Jesus Christ describes himself as Son of Man to stress his humanity
Blasphemy against the Son of Man is forgivable
Jesus Christ as the Son of Man in his prophetic ministry
The OT use of ``son of man'' as a title for Ezekiel
Jesus Christ preaches God's word
Jesus Christ offers the words of eternal life
Jesus Christ as the Son of Man in his suffering and death
Jesus Christ as a servant
Jesus Christ came to suffer, die and be raised
Jesus Christ as the Son of Man in his authority and dominion
The vision of the son of man

primaryrefs.comment: This passage provides the main OT background to Jesus Christ's understanding of himself as the ``Son of Man''. His main uses of the title emphasise his dominion and authority, and also paradoxically that this glory will be attained through the humiliation of the cross.

children.title: Son of man meaning ``son of Adam''

primaryrefs.comment: Jesus Christ as Son of Man (in the Hebrew ``son of Adam'') inherits the promise originally given to Adam of dominion over creation, which Adam forfeited because of his fall into sin.

children.title: Jesus Christ had authority on earth

primaryrefs.comment: Authority to forgive sins.

children.title: Jesus Christ is now ascended into glory
Jesus Christ will come to judge and reign over all
Jesus Christ, the Lord
children.comment: A title that signifies Jesus Christ's absolute authority and the basis on which people may know him. It is especially associated with his resurrection and return.

children.title: Lord as a title of respect for the earthly Jesus Christ
Lord as a mark of Jesus Christ's authority as a teacher
Lord as a sign of Jesus Christ's divinity
Jesus Christ's divinity

primaryrefs.comment: ``Lord'' is a common divine title in the Greek OT and is instinctively transferred to Jesus Christ in the NT.

children.title: The day of Christ Jesus

primaryrefs.comment: The ``day of Christ Jesus'' is equivalent to the OT ``day of the LORD''.

children.title: Jesus Christ is ruler over all
Jesus Christ is the Saviour
Jesus Christ is Lord of the Sabbath
Jesus the Messiah is Lord

primaryrefs.comment: ``Christ'' is the Greek equivalent of the Hebrew word ``Messiah''.

children.title: ``Jesus is Lord'' is the basic Christian statement of faith
Jesus is Lord because of the resurrection
Lord is a natural title for the risen Christ
Jesus Christ's lordship is the basis for his relationship with Christians
It is a personal relationship
``The name of the Lord'' expresses this relationship
``Jesus our Lord'' expresses this relationship
``In the Lord'' as an expression of this relationship
The ``grace of the Lord'' as God's provision for this relationship
Jesus Christ's lordship is the basis for Christian obedience
Jesus Christ's lordship will be fully revealed
Jesus Christ's lordship signifies his absolute authority
Jesus Christ as judge of all
Jesus Christ as Lord of all

cschildren.title: Titles relating to Jesus Christ's identity

children.title: The exact image of God
The first and last, the Alpha and Omega

primaryrefs.comment: ``Alpha'' and ``Omega'' are the first and last letters of the Greek alphabet.

children.title: The Word of God
The last Adam
The bright Morning Star
The rising sun
The Living One
The Amen
The true light
The Righteous One
The Lion of Judah
The king of the Jews

cschildren.title: The ``I am'' sayings of John's Gospel

seealsos.comment: the way, the truth and the life

cschildren.title: Titles relating to Jesus Christ's ministry

children.title: The seed of Abraham
The Root and Offspring of David
The faithful witness
Immanuel
The capstone
The rock
The bridegroom

primaryrefs.comment: John the Baptist describing himself as the bridegroom's friend, and Jesus Christ as the bridegroom.

children.title: The firstborn among many brothers
The firstfruits
The firstborn from the dead
The heir of all things

children.title: Lord
The head of the church
The Chief Shepherd
Prince
Rabbi

children.title: Jesus: the LORD saves
Man of sorrows
The Passover lamb
A horn of salvation
The consolation of Israel
The deliverer and Redeemer
The author and perfecter of salvation

Immanuel
children.comment: An OT name given to Jesus Christ, meaning ``God with us''.

cschildren.title: Actual uses of the name Immanuel

primaryrefs.comment: The name was given originally to a child of Isaiah's day who would signify God's salvation and judgment for Judah
The original fulfilment of the Immanuel prophecy would bring judgment on Judah
Isaiah's prophecy is fulfilled through the virginal conception of Jesus Christ.

children.title: God is with his people
God dwells with his people
Jesus Christ is always with believers
The Holy Spirit is always with believers
Messiah, coming of
children.comment: The coming of a figure chosen and anointed by God to deliver and redeem his people. Anointing was seen as a sign of being chosen by God for a special task of leadership or responsibility. The OT looked ahead to the final coming of such a figure to usher in a new era in the history of the people of God; the NT sees this expectation fulfilled in the person and work of Jesus Christ.

cschildren.title: Anointing as a sign of being chosen by God

children.title: Anointing with oil
Anointing with the Holy Spirit

Anointed to be judge

Son of Man
children.comment: A Hebrew and Aramaic term, often used to mean a human being in general. In the Gospels Jesus Christ uses it to refer to himself in his earthly ministry and his future death, exaltation and coming as judge and Saviour.

cschildren.title: Sons of men as a term for humanity in general

children.title: Human beings are inferior to God

primaryrefs.comment: The Hebrew term here translated ``man'' literally means ``sons of men''. Many of the OT references cited in this theme follow this pattern.

children.title: Human beings are dependent on God's care
Human beings are mortal
Human beings are sinful and untrustworthy

cschildren.title: Son of Man as a term for individual men

children.title: The sons of Adam

secondaryrefs.comment: ``a man'' is literally ``son of Adam'' in Hebrew

children.title: Ezekiel

primaryrefs.comment: Ezekiel is called ``son of man'' 93 times, though this form of address is unique to him in the OT. It may emphasise his remoteness or his humanity.

children.title: Other people

cschildren.title: A son of man as a ruler of God's future kingdom

primaryrefs.comment: The Aramaic ``one like a son of man'' stresses this person's humanity and mysterious identity
He enters God's presence and is given final authority over God's kingdom
He shares the kingdom with God's people.

seealsos.comment: ``saints of the Most High'' have sometimes been interpreted as angels

cschildren.title: Son of Man as a title for Jesus Christ

children.title: Used by Jesus Christ to emphasise his humanity and authority
The Son of Man receives God's kingdom
